meanings.definition: Having the property of conducting electricity to a moderate extent.
meanings.sent1: The small device used in the experiment was made of semiconducting material.
meanings.sent2: The semiconducting properties of the silicon chip allow it to control the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The semiconducting wire was feeling a bit shy and only conducted electricity when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a semiconducting circuit, allowing some thoughts to pass through while blocking others.
meanings.sent5: The semiconducting nature of the rubber band made it stretchy yet resistant to electricity.

meanings.definition: A material that has the property of conducting electricity to a moderate extent.
meanings.sent1: The factory imported a large quantity of semiconducting for their electronic devices.
meanings.sent2: Semiconducting is commonly used in the production of computer chips.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used semiconducting as a disguise to sneak into the electronics store.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a semiconducting, guiding the conversation in a controlled direction.
meanings.sent5: The scientist marveled at the unique properties of the semiconducting under the microscope.
